Note.Content: read וְשִׁלַּחְתָּם as וְשִׁלַּחְתָּ with RSV NIV NRSV REB GNT
MT HOTTP-B NIV ("spreading") NJPS ("that welled up for it") NJB ("that made it grow") | RSV NRSV REB "shoots, channels" = שֶׁלַח
The word יָד is not in the text but clearly implied

MT HOTTP-B RSV ("they drive me forth") NIV ("they lay snares for my feet") NJPS ("they put me to flight") NRSV ("they send me sprawling") GNT ("they send me running) | NJB וירגלו שׁלוי "to see when I am having a little peace" = {L:רגל<SDBH:רגל>} and {L:שָׁלֵו<SDBH:שָׁלֵו>} | REB omit

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task
= causative action by which humans or deities commission people to travel through a certain area or among a certain nation in order to perform a certain task
= causative action by which deities commission one or more people to go to a certain individual or place to inflict punishment
= causative action by which humans or deities send one or more people -- though the people sent are not mentioned explicitly -- to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task
= causative action by which humans or deities send people -- though the people sent are not mentioned explicitly -- to summon another person or group
= causative action by which humans send a message, (supposedly) in the form of a written document to someone else
= causative action by which humans or deities send an object to (other) humans, usually through the mediation of a messenger
= causative action by which humans or deities force (other) humans to go away from a certain location and/or position; ◄ due to a lack of affection, as punishment, or for other reasons
= causative action by which humans or deities shoot something at a particular target
= causative action by which humans or deities allow (other) humans to leave a certain place and go home
= causative action by which humans allow an object to sink slowly into a place situated below oneself, usually with the help of ropes
= causative action by which deities cause water to move from a certain location
literally: to send out one's branches or roots; hence: = causative action by which plants cause their branches or roots to grow and extend in a certain direction
literally: to send out one's hair; hence: = causative action by which humans allow their hair to grow long

Glosses.Gloss: to let one's hair grow long

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: to send out (one's young); hence: = process by which animals give birth
= action by which humans stretch out their hand, right hand, or finger in order to do point with it or to put it in position for another action
= action by which humans stretch out their hand, which holds an object, in order to do something with that object

literally: to send away one's feet; hence, possible: = causative action by which humans thrust aside the feet of someone who is standing up ► in order to make that person fall down; ≈ seen as an act of aggression

Glosses.Gloss: to thrust aside (someone's) feet > to send (someone) sprawling

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: to send in the fire; hence: = causative action by which humans set fire to an object
= action by which humans or deities stop caring for (other) humans or objects as if that person or object has been sent away from their presence
literally: to send; hence: = causative action by which deities cause an event to happen
= causative action by which humans remove an object that is attached to part of their body
= causative action by which humans allow (other) humans or animals to move away freely from a place where they have been confined
literally: to release one's mouth; hence: = causative action by which humans allow their mouth to utter certain words
